item.title: Chester Tomb Painting
item.description: Province Britannia Location Chester Garden Tomb Painting Keywords funerary buildings tombs Garden Description Toynbeeâ€™s suggestion that a military tombstone from Chester depicting a row of three gabled buildings with stylized trees or shrubs planted in front of the two at the sides perhaps represents a tomb garden with tomb and flanking funerary buildings, though plausible, cannot in itself be taken to show that tomb gardens existed in Roman Britain; it would, however, suggest that the concept of planting at tombs was regarded as conventionally Roman and appropriate.

item.title: Chedworth Rural Villa
item.description: Province Britannia Location Chedworth Garden Rural Villa Keywords balnea mosaics (visual works) sherds villae rusticae Garden Description This Roman villa in Gloucestershire was partially excavated in the late 19th century, but only the built features and their mosaic floors appear to have been of interest to the Victorian diggers. Excavations in the courtyard conducted between 2000 and 2002 revealed that earlier excavators had not disturbed the courtyard. Parts of the villa may date to the early 3rd century A.
